message_1: What is the probability of a patient surviving for at least 5 years given that their survival time follows an exponential distribution with a mean survival time of 3 years?
message_2:
To find the probability of a patient surviving for at least 5 years, we can use the survival function of the exponential distribution. The survival function is given by:

S(t) = P(T > t) = e^(-t/λ)

where T is the survival time, t is the time of interest (5 years in this case), and λ is the mean survival time (3 years in this case).

So, we have:

S(5) = e^(-5/3) ≈ e^(-1.67) ≈ 0.188

Therefore, the probability of a patient surviving for at least 5 years is approximately 18.8%.
